cell_id.name: cell_id
cell_id.title: Cell identifier
cell_id.description: The set of feature values as would appear in a gloss, separated by dots, eg. prs.ind.1sg or f.pl

freq_id.name: freq_id
freq_id.title: Frequency record identifier
freq_id.description: One frequency value, for a single data point and source

cell.name: cell
cell.title: Reference to a cell identifier
cell.description: The set of feature values as would appear in a gloss, separated by dots, eg. prs.ind.1sg or f.pl

unimorph.name: unimorph
unimorph.title: Cell/feature value in unimorph format
unimorph.description: The cell or feature value, written following the unimorph schema

canonical_order.name: canonical_order
canonical_order.title: Sorting order for visual presentation
canonical_order.description: The order in which items are canonically presented. Use integers to represent relative order, order is used per-item.

ud.name: ud
ud.title: Cell/feature value in the universal dependency format
ud.description: The cell or feature value, written following the universal dependency format

tag_column_name.name: tag_column_name
tag_column_name.title: Name of the tag column in the forms table
tag_column_name.description: The name of the column this tag is used in the forms table

tag_id.name: tag_id
tag_id.title: Tag id
tag_id.description: The label for a set of forms which have something in common.

value_id.name: value_id
value_id.title: Grammatical Feature value identifier
value_id.description: Identifier for the grammatical feature value (as found in the cell)

label.name: label
label.title: label for this row
label.description: A human readable label for the row.

feature.name: feature
feature.title: feature
feature.description: The name of the dimension of this feature, eg. case, tense, modality, voice, force, gender, evidentiality, person, number, polarity...

source.name: source
source.title: Source
source.description: Reference to a specific source (bibtex key). If used, the dataset should comprise a .bib file where the keys are referenced.

POS.name: POS
POS.title: Part of Speech
POS.description: The relevant part of speech for this item. This must refer to a PartOfSpeech entity from the lexinfo (https://lexinfo.net/) ontology.

form.name: form
form.title: Reference to form table row identifiers
form.description: These identifiers are specific to form, lexeme, cell triples.

form_id.name: form_id
form_id.title: Form table row identifiers
form_id.description: These identifiers are specific to form, lexeme, cell triples.

lexeme_id.name: lexeme_id
lexeme_id.title: Identifier for the lexeme
lexeme_id.description: Lexeme identifiers. Often, they are identical to the label (lemma). However, they must be unique to paradigms, distinguishing homonyms with different inflection. For example, the animal mouse/mice and the computer peripheric mouse/mouses would both have the label 'mouse' but could be identified by the lexeme identifiers mouse_1 and mouse_2.

lexeme.name: lexeme
lexeme.title: Reference to a lexeme identifier
lexeme.description: Lexeme identifiers must be unique to paradigms.

meaning.name: meaning
meaning.title: Definition for this lexeme
meaning.description: This is a description of the lexeme's overall meaning.

analysed_phon_form.name: analysed_phon_form
analysed_phon_form.title: Inflected form with analysis, such as segmentation markers (phonemic or phonetic)
analysed_phon_form.description: The form, given in phonemic or phonetic notation, with sounds separated by spaces, and analysis markers.

analysed_orth_form.name: analysed_orth_form
analysed_orth_form.title: Inflected form with analysis, such as segmentation markers (orthographic)
analysed_orth_form.description: The form, given orthographically, with markers for analysis.

phon_form.name: phon_form
phon_form.title: Inflected form (phonemic or phonetic)
phon_form.description: The form, given in phonemic or phonetic notation, with sounds separated by spaces

analysis_tag.name: analysis_tag
analysis_tag.title: Tags for marking separate analyses
analysis_tag.description: Identifies sets of forms which are related by the same analysis. Eg: forms from two distinct sources, or a more phonetic and a more phonological transcription.

defectiveness_tag.name: defectiveness_tag
defectiveness_tag.title: Tags for defectiveness status
defectiveness_tag.description: Identifies sets of defective forms (eg. pluralia tantum).

epistemic_tag.name: epistemic_tag
epistemic_tag.title: Tags for epistemic status
epistemic_tag.description: Identifies sets of forms with the same epistemic status.

variants_tag.name: variants_tag
variants_tag.title: Tags for form variants
variants_tag.description: Identifies sets of forms used by specific groups of speakers. Eg. dialectal variants.

overabundance_tag.name: overabundance_tag
overabundance_tag.title: Tags for overabundant forms
overabundance_tag.description: Identifies sets of overabundant forms. For example, overabundant forms across lexemes might belong to a series of regular and irregular forms, or a series of short and long forms, etc.

inflection_class.name: inflection_class
inflection_class.title: Inflection class identifier
inflection_class.description: This identifier groups together lexemes of the same inflection class.

language_ID.name: language_ID
language_ID.title: Identifier for the language
language_ID.description: Language identifiers should use some standard ID (iso code, glottocode, etc)

grapheme_id.name: grapheme_id
grapheme_id.title: grapheme representation
grapheme_id.description: These identifiers are specific to graphemes.

sound_id.name: sound_id
sound_id.title: sound representation
sound_id.description: These identifiers are specific to sounds.

CLTS_id.name: CLTS_id
CLTS_id.title: Identifier of this sound in CLTS
CLTS_id.description: Reference to this sound in CLTS data.

PHOIBLE_id.name: PHOIBLE_id
PHOIBLE_id.title: Identifier of this sound in PHOIBLE
PHOIBLE_id.description: Reference to this sound in PHOIBLE.
